Definition: Build-to-Order (BTO) refers to a housing scheme in Singapore where new public housing flats are built based on demand, allowing interested buyers to apply for these flats during specific application exercises. Under this scheme, buyers have the opportunity to select the location, flat type, and other desired specifications before the construction of the flats begins
Example:
1.  I heard that the new build-to-order flats in Punggol are selling out fast!
2. The government's build-to-order scheme aims to provide affordable housing options to Singaporeans.
